FuncDef:
The clock bits lti-action-2mbps command configures output actions for BITS interfaces when the 2M ring does not trace the clock source.
The undo clock bits lti-action-2mbps command disables the output actions for BITS interfaces when the 2M ring does not trace the clock source.
By default, BITS interfaces do not output clock signals when the 2M ring does not trace the clock source.
CLIs: clock bits { bits0 | bits1 | bits2 } lti-action-2mbps { send-dnu | send-ais }
clock bits bits0 lti-action-2mbps { send-dnu | send-ais } [ slot <slotid> ]
undo clock bits { bits0 | bits1 | bits2 } lti-action-2mbps [ send-dnu | send-ais ]
undo clock bits bits0 lti-action-2mbps { send-dnu | send-ais } [ slot <slotid> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the external BITS clock source is a BITS0 interface.
-

Indicates that the external BITS clock source is a BITS1 interface.
-

Indicates that the external BITS clock source is a BITS2 interface.
-

Indicates the available slot.
The value is a string of 1 to 16 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure output actions for BITS interfaces when the 2M ring does not trace the clock source, run the clock bits lti-action-2mbps command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
This command configuration is effective only when the BITS signal type is set to 2 Mbps.
